name: Ananday Cork Yoga Mat
description:
Our bestselling Cork Yoga Mat ‚Äî designed to support your body + our planet. Consciously made from plant-based, plastic-free materials ‚Äî renewable cork + natural tree rubber. No plastic. No harsh chemicals. No toxins. 100% biodegradable.
The premium cork top layer releases an organic grip-enhancing substance when wet, making it even more slip-resistant with sweat ‚Äî no towel necessary! And because cork is made from tree bark, it's naturally antimicrobial, preventing grime build-up and odors. The cork is fused with a cushioned tree rubber base for ultimate comfort to keep joints happy and healthy. Get ready for next level traction, support and stability, no matter how much you move or sweat.
Cork is one of the most earth-friendly materials available. No trees are cut down during harvest. The bark is stripped by hand every 9 years and regenerates itself. A harvested cork tree absorbs up to 5x more CO2 than one that isn‚Äôt cultivated.
¬†
"Perfect Grip! Best Mat! I have been practicing yoga for almost 15 years, have tried Manduka, Liforme, Jade, and the Ananday is my favorite. I love that it is sustainable. Definitely recommend!" ‚Äî Maria
"Best. Mat. Ever. Totally non-slip for sweaty hot yoga, supports sensitive knees (I often have to use a blanket for the knees, but not with this mat), great thickness, beautiful, well-made, biodegradable... I've tried so many mats, and this one is undoubtedly my favorite. Love at first use. Using these mats for the rest of my life!" ‚Äî Anton
"Finally, a yoga mat where my hands don't slip! I've had a hard time finding a yoga mat where my sweaty hands don't slide but this cork yoga mat did the trick!" ‚Äî Nick
1 mat = 1 tree planted üå≥¬†
¬†

Product details


72" x 24" x 4mm | 5.4 lbs
Renewable cork + natural tree rubber

Natural, non-toxic, plastic-free

Non-slip and sweat resistant

Rolls out flat and stays put
Unmatched comfort and stability 

Antimicrobial ‚Äî goodbye funky odors
Reversible ‚Äî flip to rubber side for extra traction
Plastic-free production and packaging

100% biodegradable (learn how we pack)

*Traction tip ‚Äî spray water around hands and feet before practice for extra grip.
*Advanced tip ‚Äî if you're practicing inversions like forearm stand and handstand and would like to maximize traction, flip the mat over.
Why cork?

Cork releases an organic grip-enhancing substance when wet so it gets even more grippy with sweat ‚Äî no towel necessary!
Made from bark, which forms to protect trees, so it's naturally antimicrobial and stays earthy and fresh day in, day out.

Cork is one of the most earth-friendly materials. No trees are cut down during harvest. The bark is collected by hand every 9 years and regenerates itself. Cork oak trees can live up to 200 years and a harvested tree absorbs up to 5x more CO2 than one that isn‚Äôt cultivated.¬†Cork trees support some of the world‚Äôs most biodiverse forests.
Practicing on materials from the earth is grounding. Our hands and feet have marma points (or energy pathways) that connect to the planet's subtle energy. Grounding balances biological rhythms, calms the nervous system, and helps our body heal.

Care


Roll your mat up loosely, careful to not fold or crease


Cork is naturally antimicrobial, preventing germ and odor buildup; for a deeper clean, simply spray with a natural mat cleaner and let dry

Cleaning recommended 1x weekly (more frequently with heated classes) to prevent body oils from building up and to keep the mat feeling fresh
Since this mat is biodegradable and will (eventually) decompose, prolong its life by avoiding direct sunlight and extended water exposure

With extensive use, surface cracking may occur ‚Äî this is purely visual and does not affect the feel or durability of the mat


End of life

Cork and tree rubber are 100% biodegradable
If and when you're ready to part with your mat, consider a donation or drop it off at a recycling center
Our packaging is also biodegradable and recyclable ‚Äî¬†learn how we pack

Happiness guarantee
We're a small woman-owned brand committed to quality and sustainability. Our pieces are made from natural, sustainable, plant-based materials ‚Äî no plastics, no toxins, 100% biodegradable and recyclable, including the packaging. We love our products and think you will too! But if you're not 100% satisfied with your purchase, return or exchange within 30 days, no questions asked.

Cork oak trees can live up to 200 years and¬†a¬†harvested tree absorbs up to 5x more CO2 than one that isn‚Äôt cultivated.¬†Cork trees support some of the world‚Äôs most biodiverse forests.
Practicing on materials from the earth is grounding. Our hands and feet have marma points (or energy pathways) that connect to the planet's subtle energy. Grounding balances biological rhythms, calms the nervous system, and helps our body heal.

Care

Roll your mat up loosely, careful to not fold or crease
To clean, spray the Salutation Spray, wipe down, and let dry
Cleaning recommended 1x weekly (more frequently with heated classes) to help prevent body oils from building up and keep your mat fresh

When your Salutation Spray is running low, we have a refill option!

End of life

Cork and tree rubber are 100% biodegradable
Aluminum is infinitely recyclable (fun fact: 75% of all aluminum ever produced is still in use today)
Sprayer is reusable and recyclable
Our packaging is also biodegradable and recyclable ‚Äî¬†learn how we pack


Happiness guarantee
We're a small woman-owned brand committed to quality and sustainability. Our pieces are made from natural, sustainable, plant-based materials ‚Äî no plastics, no toxins, 100% biodegradable and recyclable, including the packaging. We love our products and think you will too! But if you're not 100% satisfied with your purchase, return or exchange within 30 days, no questions asked.

name: Africa by Jess Guzman Yoga mat - Art Collection - 4mm
description:
CONOCE A LA ARTISTA
JESS GUZMAN, Colombiana, Arquitecta de profesi√≥n y artista de vocaci√≥n. Me encuentro muy inclinado hacia la pintura; dibuja y pinta desde ni√±a porque eso la hace sentir libre. Encuentra en l√°piz y papel la manera de materializar sus pensamientos y emociones.
Suele inspirarse en las formas de la naturaleza, y su estilo es una mezcla entre boceto, caricatura y abstracci√≥n.
La idea de dibujar para House of Mats la entusiasm√≥. Le encanta el concepto que Luc√≠a, la due√±a, tiene de la marca, pero m√°s que eso, la historia que hay detr√°s y las razones que la motivaron.
Las ilustraciones de House surgen del concepto mismo de la marca: los colores, las posturas, la conexi√≥n con la naturaleza, la energ√≠a del sol y del universo, dando como resultado una serie de im√°genes sencillas, realizadas a mano con un trazo suave, la que comunican los conceptos b√°sicos del yoga.
Nada es absoluto, todo es complementario, y de ese tr√°nsito surge la idea.
Sobre el dise√±o: El elefante en general es un animal que se asemeja a los humanos, es sociable y disfruta de la uni√≥n familiar. Adem√°s, los elefantes crean fuertes lazos con su familia y amigos, hasta el punto de poder identificarse despu√©s de un tiempo sin verse.

name: Meditation Mats ‚Äì Handwoven Darbha Grass Mats -  JadeYoga
description:
Handwoven Darbha Grass meditation mats will transport you to a natural state of meditation with their earthy grass feel and scent.


Meditate in peace¬†with a Darbha grass mat and enjoy the natural scent of the mat

Made from Darbha grass and cotton.¬†Darbha grass is a tropical grass that grows in India and is considered sacred.

Click here¬†for a review from Business Insider.¬†¬†

Dimensions:¬†26" wide and 72" long

Please use over a Jade mat to prevent slipping on hard floors such as hardwood, laminate, or tile floors.

Made by local artisans in India:¬†Jade's Darbha grass meditation mats are handwoven by rural artisans, preserving a tradition and art form and providing a livelihood for weavers. Weaving is a traditional way of life for many people in this area of India and has seen a massive decline in recent years as it can be very difficult to make a living with weaving and many people have left in search of other jobs. These¬†rugs support the traditional weavers and allow them to use their skills to support their families. For many of them, this is the only job they have ever had and making these rugs allows them to keep this tradition alive. Please click here to hear our weaver talk about his work.¬†

Be The Change: Through our partnership with the Akshaya Patra Foundation, with each Darbha Grass meditation mat purchased, Jade will provide a week of hot lunches for a child in India.

name: Recycled Sari Yoga Rug - JadeYoga
description:
Perfect for Outdoor Use:¬†Jade's¬†recycled sari yoga rugs are perfect for all kinds of yoga classes, including Ashtanga, outdoor classes, and beach yoga.¬†Please use it on top of your Jade mat to prevent slipping when using it on hard surfaces such as hardwood, laminate, and tile floors.

Sustainable: Made with recycled cotton and a mix of Sari Materials which are made of a variety of silk materials.¬†

Handmade:¬†Created by the Local Women's Handicraft (LWH) in Nepal. LWH seeks to¬†empower and educate women, enabling them to write their own destinies.

Empowering Women:¬†LWH provides a safe space for women who have escaped abusive practices in the textile industry and other injustices in their local communities. Their manufacturing facilities allow these women to learn new skills and crafts as a group to help heal and rehabilitate their spirits.

Ethical Fashion: Through raising awareness and making fashion an ethical way, their goal is to end childhood slavery, forced marriage, and other injustices against women.

Dimensions:¬†24" x 72"

Care Instructions: Washing: Hand wash or machine wash on gentle cycle, opt for cold water as often as possible. Use lukewarm water when needed. Do not use bleach. Drying: We recommend air-dry only. Do not tumble dry. Our upcycled materials are mainly made from silk fabrics and other materials, silk is very delicate and the high temperatures of the tumble dryer can shrink or damage your silks. Ironing: Iron on low setting if needed.

name: Yoga Mat Forest Design
description:
This artwork is created by Emma Hall : "I was really inspired by retro floral patterns from the 60s and 70s that use this clearly hand-drawn element to create a more fun and organic pattern. My aim was to infuse these patterns with modern colors and details to give them a more modern edge. To create the design I use purely hand-drawings which are then scanned and vectorised to allow resizing and colouring."Emma is a British designer from Cambridge. Her biggest joy in her work is colour. The process involved usually centres around mixing analogue and digital methods. Subjects are generally drawn from nature, such as, imagined or real African landscapes, wildflowers and animals. Her travels growing up and Mozambican heritage may have also contributed to these interests. This design is featured on a premium vegan suede yoga mat, combining Emma's vibrant artistry with eco-conscious functionality.

THE KID‚Äö is MAT

 EARTH CONSCIOUS
        
            Natural tree rubber base, recycled PET microfiber, and water-based inks.
            Free of silicone, toxic glue, and phthalates.
        
    
    
 CARE INSTRUCTIONS
        
            Depending on the type of practice, how much you sweat, and personal preference, we recommend washing your Combo Mat every 1-3 uses. If you choose to not wash your mat, hang to dry away from direct 
                sunlight. Roll with the patterned side on the outside for storage or travel. 
            
            We recommend hand-washing to extend the life of your mat. If you choose to machine wash, please do so on a gentle cycle with a machine without a center agitator. Hang to dry away from direct sunlight.

name: Travel Cork Yoga Mat - Mandala Black
description:
THE CORK MAT

Unlike most of our competition, our Cork Mat is made with a 100% natural rubber base layer topped with a renewable, sustainable cork top layer.
While natural cork provides superior wet and dry grip, it is ideal in heated and hot yoga classes because as temperatures rise, cork begins to loosen and becomes softer & easier to grip. It's also moisture-activated - becoming grippier as it gets wet. Truly nature's best solution for towel-free traction. Cork is also closed-cell and naturally anti-microbial, sealing out moisture & resisting odor and bacteria from sweat.
Our natural rubber base layer offers a unique springy ride that cushions and protects joints, while also remaining stable and supportive in any pose. Stays put on the floor better than foam base layers and provides denser cushioning.
The stunning, symmetrical pattern helps guide alignment, and is printed using a non-fade water-based ink.
Note:  The foldable 1.5mm option is excellent for yogis on the go, and also provides an excellent non-slip, natural "topper" to other mats.



 PRO TIP

For optimal grip, lightly spritz your mat with water before practice.



 DURABLE

Supports any practice from a high intensity workout to a gentle flow. Suitable for shoes.



 EARTH CONSCIOUS

 

Sustainable, renewable cork top layer made from the outer layer of bark from the cork oak tree. (Cork trees are the only tree in the world that regenerate stripped bark.)
Base layer is made with natural, non-Amazonian harvested tree rubber.
All of our beautiful designs are printed with water-based inks.
Phthalate, silicone and toxin-fee.




 CARE INSTRUCTIONS

To clean, wipe with a soft towel dampened with soap and water; lay flat or hang to air dry.
Roll with the colored/designed side on the outside.



 DIMENSIONS

70"(178 cm) long x 24"(61 cm) wide
1.5mm thick = 3.5 lb (1.6 kg)
Includes carrying strap
features: Eco-Friendly; Non-Slip; Lightweight; Extra Wide; Alignment Marks; Closed-Cell

name: Combo Yoga Mat - Mandala Sapphire
description:
THE COMBO MAT

The Combo Mat was designed to be the ultimate hot yoga and sweaty companion. An ultra-absorbent and colorful microfiber towel top layer, bonded to a natural tree rubber base.
Perfect for a sweaty grip or for added balance stability; No more towel bunching, as this is an ALL-in-ONE product.



 PRO TIP

For optimal grip, wet your hands or spritz a little water on your mat before practice. Sweat will also help you adhere to your mat.



 EARTH CONSCIOUS

Natural tree rubber base, recycled PET microfiber, and water-based inks. Free of silicone, toxic glue, and phthalates.



 CARE INSTRUCTIONS

Depending on the type of practice, how much you sweat, and personal preference, we recommend washing your Combo Mat every 1-3 uses. If you choose to not wash your mat, hang to dry away from direct sunlight. Roll with the patterned side on the outside for storage or travel.
We recommend hand-washing to extend the life of your mat. If you choose to machine wash, please do so on a gentle cycle with a machine without a center agitator. Hang to dry away from direct sunlight.



 DETAILS

3.5 mm of natural tree rubber + recycled PET microfiber top layer70 in (178 cm) x 24 in (61 cm) x 3.5 mm, 4.9 lb (2.2 kg)Includes carrying strap

name: Yogamatters Aqua Evolve Yoga Mat
description:
Sustainability innovation at its best -¬†a yoga mat that actually helps to clean the environment!
The Yogamatters Aqua Evolve yoga mat is made from a unique combination of EVA foam and algae from lakes and ponds.¬†
Algae blooms pose a major problem for communities around the world causing eco-systems to become out of balance. They are caused by factors such as climate change, water pollution from agriculture, industry and society.
Our partners at BLOOM have found an innovative way of helping the environment by turning algae blooms¬†into eco-foams for use in products.¬†
During algae harvesting, the algae is separated from the water and the clean, filtered and oxygenated water is returned back into the environment. Helping to restore the eco-system.¬†Algae also absorbs and traps CO2 from the atmosphere through the process of photosynthesis. When the algae is harvested, the CO2 comes along with it, which means cleaner air too!
For every mat, 64 litres of cleaned water are returned to the local habitat as well as 40 cubic metres of clean air.¬†

Uses reclaimed/recycled materials certified by¬†the Global Recycling Standard (GRS)¬†

name: Manduka eKO Lite 3.0 4mm Yoga Mat
description:
Built sustainably for the mindful yogi, the updated Manduka eKO¬Æ lite 4mm yoga mat provides an improved Catch-Grip‚Ñ¢ surface texture for traction in wet and dry conditions, combined with Responsive Ride‚Ñ¢ layer for a cushioned, springy ride. All Manduka eKO¬Æ Series yoga mats have a closed-cell surface, which will never absorb moisture. Because of this, if you are warm or sweaty, the yoga mat will feel slippery, so we always recommend pairing it with a hand towel to absorb moisture and provide extra traction or to apply Yoga Grip Gel during your practice. name: Yoga Design Lab Cork Mat 3.5mm - Natural Balance
description:
The Cork Yoga Mat is the most sustainable choice within yoga mats.
Cork is lightweight, allowing for more efficient shipping to the factory. The yoga mat cork is supported by a base of natural non-slip rubber from Vietnam. Only water-based inks are used for the prints, leaving you with a fully sustainable and beautiful piece of art. Cork is antimicrobial, meaning you don‚Äôt need harmful chemicals to clean your collection. Organic soap and water are sufficient and if you get any major stains, you can actually file down the cork a bit and avoid cleaners altogether!

Designed to love the earth and your practice
Non-slip grip that improves with sweat
High-density cushion for support
Durable: Premium quality for the most rigorous studio conditions or at home
Eco-friendly: biodegradable natural cork and rubber with water-based inks
Free from silicone, pvc, and phthalates
Easy to Clean: antimicrobial cork
Includes carrying strap


Cork trees grow around the Mediterranean naturally and on farms. The mat cork is sourced and certified from tree farms in Portugal. The bark of the cork tree can be harvested every 9-10 years during its 200-year life span. The tree is not harmed during the process; it actually allows for greater absorption of CO2 while the bark regrows.
If a tree does reach its end life, two new saplings are planted in its place thus ensuring the cork forest continues to flourish and renew. The harvested cork bark is shredded to a pulp and pressed into long sheets to be used in products. Any leftover cork dust is used to fuel the mills.
If you no longer need your products, cork is compostable. Better yet, you can find a local agency to upcycle your cork or find DIY inspiration online to upcycle your cork.

For those of you who like to sweat - this is your yoga mat! An eco-friendly, ultra-absorbent microfiber top layer is bonded to a natural rubber base layer to provide the ultimate in sweat management and stability. This mat is actually "moisture activated," and gets grippier the wetter it gets.
Say goodbye to towel bunching forever with our ultimate 2-in-1 combination.
The foldable,1.5mm thickness is IDEAL for travel or easy transport.
For optimal grip, lightly spritz your mat with water before practice. Sweat will also help you adhere to the mat.

Recycled PET microfiber top layer is made using 15 plastic bottles.
Base layer is made with sustainable, non-Amazonian natural tree rubber.
All of our beautiful designs are printed with water-based inks.
Phthalate, silicone and toxin-fee.

name: Jade Yoga Organic Cotton Mysore Yoga Rug
description:
Back to the roots - With Jade's organic cotton Mysore yoga rugs you can feel closer to the traditional roots of Yoga. They're¬†perfect for all kinds of yoga, including Ashtanga, outdoor classes, and beach yoga. 
Jade`s Mysore rugs are handwoven by rural artisans in India, preserving a tradition and art form and providing a livelihood for weavers. Weaving is a traditional way of life for many people in this region, which has experienced an enormous decline in recent years due to increasing industrialization. These rugs support the traditional weavers and enable them to use their skills to support their families as well as to keep this tradition alive.
They are made with organic cotton and all natural vegetable dyes made from herbs¬†including indigo, cumin and turmeric. The herbal dyes are specially made in small batches in order to get the most color and benefits from the herbs.
These rugs are lightweight at only 1.13kg and can easily be taken outdoors to the park or the beach. They are also machine washable with cold water, making them easy to care for. (note that rugs may shrink slightly in the wash). Wash colours separately and hang to air dry (will shrink if put in a dryer).
When using on hard surfaces such as hardwood, laminate and tile floors, please use on top of your Jade mat (natural rubber mats) or other non-slip underlay to prevent slipping.
With the purchase of each rug, Jade provides a week of hot lunches to a child in need in India.

name: Yoga Design Lab Cork Mat 3.5mm - Mandala Black
description:
The Cork Yoga Mat is the most sustainable choice within yoga mats.
Cork is lightweight, allowing for more efficient shipping to the factory. The yoga mat cork is supported by a base of natural non-slip rubber from Vietnam. Only water-based inks are used for the prints, leaving you with a fully sustainable and beautiful piece of art. Cork is antimicrobial, meaning you don‚Äôt need harmful chemicals to clean your collection. Organic soap and water are sufficient and if you get any major stains, you can actually file down the cork a bit and avoid cleaners altogether!

Designed to love the earth and your practice.
Non-slip grip that improves with sweat
Symmetrical design aids alignment
High-density cushion for support
Durable:¬†Premium quality for the most rigorous studio conditions or at home
Eco-friendly: biodegradable natural cork and rubber with water-based inks.
Free from silicone, pvc, and phthalates
Easy to Clean: antimicrobial cork
Includes carrying strap

Cork trees grow around the Mediterranean naturally and on farms. The mat cork is sourced and certified from tree farms in Portugal. The bark of the cork tree can be harvested every 9-10 years during its 200-year life span. The tree is not harmed during the process; it actually allows for greater absorption of CO2 while the bark regrows.
If a tree does reach its end life, two new saplings are planted in its place thus ensuring the cork forest continues to flourish and renew. The harvested cork bark is shredded to a pulp and pressed into long sheets to be used in products. Any leftover cork dust is used to fuel the mills.
If you no longer need your products, cork is compostable. Better yet, you can find a local agency to upcycle your cork or find DIY inspiration online to upcycle your cork.
